short_description:
Meraculous2 is a whole genome shotgun assembler for short-reads that is capable of assembling large, polymorphic genomes with modest computational requirements. Meraculous relies on an efficient and conservative traversal of the subgraph of the k-mer (deBruijn) graph of oligonucleotides with unique high quality extensions in the dataset, avoiding an explicit error correction step as used in other short-read assemblers.  
Additional features include:
- Fast and memory-efficient k-mer counts
- Handling of diploid allelic variation
- Improved scaffolding that produces more complete assemblies without compromising on scaffolding accuracy.  
- Gap closing using localized assemblies

The assembly process is driven by a Perl pipeline where different stages can be executed and re-executed separately or in unison, allowing greater transparency and control by the user.
